newsitem.title: CHINA: Korea Pohang in $240 mln China projects.
newsitem.headline: Korea Pohang in $240 mln China projects.

text.p: South Korea's Pohang Iron and Steel has started work on three steel ventures in China with a total investment of $240 million, Xinhua news agency said on Tuesday.
Pohang and Chinese partner Jiangsu Shagang Group inaugurated the three steel projects on Monday in Zhangjiagang in China's eastern province of Jiangsu, Xinhua said.
The new projects would produce 100,000 tonnes of cold-rolled thin stainless steel plates and 100,000 tonnes of zinc-plated steel plates a year, the agency said.
The projects would also process 140,000 tonnes of various kinds of steel plates and other products, it said.
The projects would be Pohang's biggest investment in China and were scheduled to begin operation in November 1997, May 1998 and March 1999, Xinhua said. It gave no further details.
